Posts.Content: Sep 22, 2011 11:48AM jamjam29 wrote: Hey Mom, thanks for the reply :) The only known family history is that my Grandfather was diagnosed with breast cancer at 30 and had to have a Mastectomy. I found it very odd that a 3cm mass wouldn't show on an US either until I've read that it happens more then we think! I think I am going to review the results with my doc and maybe request an MRI just to be safe :)  Thanks
Posts.Title: Anyone told they're too young? jamjam29 kennessee

Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2011 07:31AM jamjam29 wrote: Wow Iwarstler, I will be asking about the biopsy for sure!! And I am not big in the chest (average deflated C) so that really doesn't makes sense to me :s Kimmer I will post the results for sure!
Posts.Title: Anyone told they're too young? jamjam29 kennessee

Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2011 07:58AM jamjam29 wrote: I really wish there was a way to change how we look for abnormal lumps and bumps :(   I can't imagine thinking everything was ok and then finding out. Sorry

Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2011 07:23AM jamjam29 wrote: Ok so I just got off the phone with my doc's office and they are going to get a copy of my US report for me to pick up!!!! :) I am very happy about this as I didn't think we were able to do that in Ontario!! I've noticed there is a section in the forum to help better understand these reports so I think I will be hitting that once I have report in hand and then I will definitely update you all on what's happening :)
Posts.Title: Anyone told they're too young? jamjam29 kennessee

Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2011 07:37AM jamjam29 wrote: Jade- No I don't think I can get more scared lol I really am thankful that I am getting this information now rather then later. I have tried to search the internet about everything I possibly can, but I think I'm the only young person with bad Googlefoo!!! I had no idea about the significance of my grandfather, thank you! i will be sure to bring him up again! PLJ- I was thinking about an MRI, but is it something I am allowed to just request?? I have a really hard time expressing myself to docs if I don't agree with them, I am getting better given the circumstances, but what if they say no??

Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2011 07:52AM jamjam29 wrote: Ok Kimmer, so biopsy and MRI are now added to the doc to do list ;) I never thought of it that before PLJ, but no test is worth more then my life! Good point!!!

Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2011 07:55AM jamjam29 wrote: I can bring my hubby, he has been through cancer and never went unheard
Posts.Title: Anyone told they're too young? jamjam29 kennessee

Posts.Content: jamjam29 wrote: Hi everyone  I would like to first thank you all for being there when I needed you! I kind of creeped at first but I think I'm officially a lifer now ;)  I'm 29 yrs old and found a lump a few months ago (well I think it was a few months, my husband was going through cancer for a while so time kinda stopped) and now I just rediscovered it. From what I can tell it has grown in size and that's it. It doesn't hurt or move so I decided to go get checked out by the doctor. After they checked me too, they agreed that they could feel a lump about 3cm in diameter. I was scheduled for an US and it took all of a minute and a half, maybe 2 for the full imaging and consult with the radiologist before the technician came back and told me that I'm too young and it's normal breast tissue, if I was still feeling off about it over the next couple months I could go back. This happened so very quick that I didn't get that piece of mind that I was hoping for and now am left wondering if anyone else has gone thourhg the whole "you're too young" thing?? Should I get a second opinion?? Thanks in advance ladies! You are all little tiny angels within my computer to me :)  Jenn Peace and Love aren't that hard <3 Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Anyone told they're too young? jamjam29 kennessee

Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2011 07:15AM jamjam29 wrote: Wow! Thanks ladies, I guess I just needed to make sure that I wasn't being overly worried about this whole situation. I did mention the family history to my doc and she said they worry if it's a sister or mother, but I did write it down on my questionnaire form anyways. I did call the doc yesterday and I have a follow up appt to go over my US results, so I will request something more. I forgot to mention that when I first had my doc feel the lump she said she couldn't biopsy it because it felt to deep, so should I ask to go to a breast surgeon then?  Thank you again for helping me through this period of my life, I only hope that one day I can be there for you the way you have for me
